reviews.positive_text: L’emplacement géographique
reviews.negative_text:
Le confort et la propreté de l’hôtel laissent à désirer. Le matelas était très dur, et les coussins contenaient des plumes, ce qui peut poser problème aux personnes allergiques — il est donc préférable d’apporter son propre coussin. La salle de bain avait des signes de vétusté, avec des traces de moisissures, et la connexion Wi-Fi était de mauvaise qualité (je captais mieux en pleine campagne qu’à l’hôtel). Enfin, la housse de la couette était déchirée.
Pour 393€ les 3 nuits, on pourrait s’attendre à bien mieux, la localisation fait le prix.

reviews.positive_text:
L’hôtel est à 30 secondes du centre du Palais de l’Isle. Il y a de nombreux bars et restaurants sympa juste en dessous de l’hôtel et dans les alentours. Pratique quand nous ne sommes là que pour 1 nuit. La chambre est bien décorée même si un peu petite. Équipements complets à disposition. Le petit déjeuner est correcte (sucré et salé). Le personnel est sympathique et accueillant. 
PS : je vous conseille d’aller manger une bonne fondue savoyarde « Chez Mamie Lise » à 3 min à pied de l’hôtel 👌🏻

reviews.positive_text: l'emplacement de l'hôtel est excellent, sa facilité d'accès depuis le centre ainsi que sa proximité du lac et des commerces et des lieux de visite, le rend particulièrement agréable ainsi que sa vue sur le canal.
reviews.negative_text: l'agencement de la chambre n'est absolument pas confortable, il devrait être précisé que la chambre est sous les toits avec un plafond très bas au niveau du lit ainsi que au niveau de la salle de bain, pour exemple, je mesure 1M80 et pour tenir debout dans la baignoire je dois mettre ma tête à 90 degrés, pas forcément agréable et pratique. le fait de réunir deux matelas de 1 personne pour faire un grand lit n'est pas confortable non plus. Nous pouvons comprendre que pour des raisons de préservation de l'architecture, on ne puisse pas mettre de volets, mais il existe de meilleures solutions que un simple rideau trop petit et n'épousant pas la forme de la fenêtre.

reviews.positive_text: Nous avons séjourné au Palais de l’Isle. Ce que nous avons particulièrement apprécié, c’est la gentillesse du personnel ainsi que l’emplacement idéal en plein centre d’Annecy.
reviews.negative_text: En revanche, plusieurs points nous ont vraiment déçus : la propreté laissait à désirer, certaines portes avaient même des trous qui donnaient l’impression d’avoir été rongées, ce qui n’est pas rassurant. La salle de bain n’était pas pratique du tout, surtout la douche qui devient quasiment inutilisable si l’on mesure plus d’1m85. La télévision ne fonctionnait pas non plus, ce qui ajoute à l’impression générale de négligence.

Pendant les moments de repos, nous étions obligés d’ouvrir la fenêtre, ce qui nous empêchait de dormir jusqu’à tard dans la nuit à cause du passage des gens. Et à partir de 4 heures du matin, les voisins de l’hôtel commençaient à déplacer leurs affaires avec un chariot métallique, dont le bruit était si fort qu’il nous empêchait de dormir. Durant les deux nuits de notre séjour, je n’ai pu dormir confortablement qu’entre 6 h et 9 h du matin.

l'emplacement
reviews.negative_text:
Contrairement à ce qui est indiqué et qui avait motivé mon choix, les chambres ne sont PAS climatisées ou bien la clim était en panne. Quand bien même celle-ci fonctionnerait, le système est fait de telle façon que lorsque vous quittez la chambre, vous devez prendre avec vous votre carte d'accès, ce qui a pour effet de couper l'électricité et la ventilation dans la chambre. 
Lors du départ, plusieurs clients se sont plein de l'absence de climatisation efficace mais le responsable a cherché a nier le problème en faisant preuve de mauvaise foi plutôt que de s'excuser ; il a cependant consenti une réduction du prix. 
D'autre part, la propreté laissait à désirer puisque nous avons trouvé des déchets sous le lavabo de la salle de bain.

reviews.positive_text: Hôtel très agréable et idéalement situé en plein centre-ville, entouré de restaurants, de bars et de petits commerces. L’accueil est chaleureux, et le petit déjeuner est excellent, servi avec beaucoup de gentillesse et de bonne humeur par une dame adorable qui veille à ce que tout se passe bien. Les chambres sont très bien isolées : on n’entend absolument rien de ce qui se passe dans la rue, ce qui permet de passer des nuits très calmes.

L'emplacement au coeur de la vieille ville d'Annecy. La vue magnifique sur le Thioule et le Pont de l'Ile. Sur l'église St François de la Salle juste en face. Jusqu'au lac, vers le Pont des Amours. Chambre joliment décoré, qui respecte la tradition tout en êtant moderne et fonctionnelle. Bonne literie, oreillers, matelas. Moquette ultra soyeuse sur le sol, bien isolée phoniquement. Climatisation individuelle dans la chambre, un grand avantage de pouvoir avoir chaud la nuit par une météo capricieuse de début mars.

Personnel d Acceuil qui en fait trop “language trop soutenu” qui ne correspond pas à l hôtel ça mais mal à l aise + la musique à fond à la réception le matin (du Renaud …)  on se demande si ce n est pas une caméra cachée. 
Même si on demande un arrangement bien à l avance pour avoir la chambre ce n est pas possible . Ils ne cherchent pas à savoir pourquoi et s arranger. 
Matelas moyenne gamme, chambre vendue pour un lit double et un canapé… mais le lit double n a pas de sommier c est du convertible amélioré . 
Impossible de se reposer en journée hyper bruyant avec la rue passante en bas. 
Hôtel digne d un labyrinthe avec plein de couloir et de marche pour naviguer avec des bagages ou handicape c est pas facile et contraignant. 
N ai pas pris le petit dej vu le prix , mais vu que j ai vu de servi en partant je ne regrette pas.
Les femmes de chambres étaient très cordiale et souriante.

reviews.review_title: En plain coeur d'Annecy il vous ferra un magnifique séjour.
reviews.positive_text: Cette hotel est peu-être le mieux placé en plain coeur d'Annecy juste a coté du Chateau. Le fait d'être en zone piétonne, lui donne plus de calme avec access a pied a tout Annecy, et ils ont un ticket bonus pour le parking qui est tres agréable. Le parking plus proche n'est qu'a 260m et très facile de faire a pied. L'hotel a été renouvelé et tout est bien et agréable. La chambre été bien décoré et équipe, très silencieuse. Nous avons choisi le petit déjeuner le premier jour en ville, mais le dernier a l'hotel, et il était aussi parfait. Je conseillerais cet hotel a tous. 48h magnifiques dans cette belle ville, ou l'hotel a bien fait partie de la qualité de notre séjour.

reviews.review_title: Hôtel moderne, très bien situé avec du personnel très professionnel
reviews.positive_text: La situation géographique exceptionnelle permet d'accéder à la vieille ville à pied et de se balader très facilement. Il est très pratique de pouvoir repasser à l'hôtel rapidement lors de la découverte de la ville. Situé dans une zone piétonne, l'hôtel fournit également un bon de réduction sur certains parkings payants situés à proximité. En ce qui concerne l'hôtel, il est calme, très bien tenu et la décoration récente. Au niveau de la chambre, la qualité de la literie est très bonne et notre chambre bénéficiait d'une très belle vue dégagée. Dernier aspect très apprécié, l'accueil a été très professionnel avec recommandations sur les restaurants traditionnels de la ville ainsi que des indications précises sur le marché se tenant dans la vieille ville afin de découvrir les spécialités régionales.

reviews.positive_text: Small hotel located in the old city center, hard to find by taxi drivers if you want to order one, so you have to walk if you come by train or Flix bus to Annecy (if you also catch a local fair that is organized right on the streets of the old center, you unintentionally participate in a procession like via dolorosa in Jerusalem in a crowd that is difficult to describe in words)
reviews.negative_text: Poor breakfast compared to the price paid, few products offered, customers have to boil their own eggs, so the vast majority, not knowing that they are not boiled, break them raw with all the inconvenience that entails !!

reviews.review_title: Perfect location for a short stay
reviews.positive_text: We loved our room, it had a little balcony over the canal. The location was perfect! The room itself was small but nicely furnished with everything we needed. It was comfortable and surprisingly quiet inside considering how central the location is.
reviews.negative_text: We got there about 10 minutes before the official check in time and the lady on the desk was happy to store our bags but said to come back in half an hour. I mentioned that I thought the check in time was 3pm and she just told me that there are lots of rooms to clean. This wasn’t a massive problem but I found her tone dismissive and she didn’t apologise at all for the delay. When we returned there was another lady at the desk who was much friendlier and made us feel welcome. The only other negative thing was that the bathroom has some mould staining and the vanity was water damage as there is no shower screen.

reviews.review_title: Great location and very kind staff, but my stay was impacted by unresolved issues and inflexible booking policies
reviews.positive_text: I really appreciated the central location of the hotel—it made getting around very easy—and the staff were consistently kind and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable!
reviews.negative_text:
Unfortunately, my experience was impacted by a few frustrations. The air conditioning in my room didn’t work, and despite raising the issue, it was never resolved during my stay. Additionally, when I asked to shorten my stay for several reasons, my request was declined, which added to my disappointment. I believed it was because I had prepaid my room, however, this was not the case.

With a few improvements to responsiveness and flexibility, this could have been a much more positive experience.

reviews.positive_text: Location
reviews.negative_text: Ineffective air conditioning and fridge, no coffee machine, small window , shower wasn’t great water went under shower screen and all over the floor

reviews.review_title: Great place to stay if location is priority, but some TLC needed
reviews.positive_text:
The location of the hotel is perfect. We also had a room with a view of the bridge and lake, which was a lovely bonus. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and spoke excellent English. 
I can’t comment on the parking as we left it too late to get a sticker for the car to enter the city, but for those in a similar circumstance, I would recommend parking at ‘Parking ILOA’ (Pringy) for secure parking outside the zone - it cost under €30 for 2 nights, 3 days.
reviews.negative_text: The hotel really could be made excellent with some renovations, or at the very least, some TLC. Whilst clean, everything felt a bit ‘tired’. Our shower (stand-up) was caked in black mould - it shouldn’t be too hard for the hotel to re-grout the shower. It felt really dirty in the shower, even though it had been cleaned. Lots of potential for this hotel, but they need to invest in the upkeep a little more.

reviews.review_title: Great location, great value for money.
reviews.positive_text: The location was fantastic and the staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful.
reviews.negative_text: Difficult to shower without getting a lot of water on floor but this is a minor quibble.

reviews.positive_text: The hotel is in the centre of Annecy, close to the lake and many restaurants and cafés. There are a lot of interesting small alleys to wander along and explore, and the views of the mountains across the lake are quite stunning. The room was nice, everything worked, and the staff were pleasant and helpful.
reviews.negative_text: It's no fault of the hotel, but if you are driving a car, then the network of one-way systems, bus only lanes, bus only streets, and pedestrian ways is a nightmare when you aren't familiar with them. Best to set your navigator to take you directly to the underground car park nearby at the Hôtel de Ville, then walk the 100 m or so to the hotel. The hotel offers a discount for this car park.

reviews.positive_text: You could not get a more central location. Right next to the Palais du l’isle.
reviews.negative_text: It was ok. I think it promised more than it gave. For the money I would have expected a shower you could stand up in. Car parking was straightforward and with the hotel discount was reasonably priced, if you don’t mind carrying all your luggage to the hotel.

reviews.review_title: Great city.  Will come back some day.
reviews.positive_text: Great location.  Close to the old town. The staff was friendly. Clean room.
reviews.negative_text: Very small room.  Expensive for what you get.  You are paying for location.

reviews.positive_text: The room is smaller in space than it looks in the pictures the if you are to stay on the fifth floor be ready for the very steep stairs as the elevator will not take you there. However, the location is in the middle of the downtown which makes it a walking distance from everywhere

Location was fantastic.  The place was updated but the rooms are very small. The AC did not work and the noise level prevented keeping windows open. Its location made up for it.  Right in the heart of the Old Town and close to lake.  Annecy is spectacular but if you book here, splurge on a bigger room.

reviews.review_title: A charming hotel in the perfect location.
reviews.positive_text: The location and charm of this hotel is superb. We were initially disappointed we weren't getting a view of the canal with our premium room, but actually the view we DID have of the castle and the old town was delightful. The hotel is exactly where you want to be, within mere steps of the cobbled streets, restaurants, bars, market, canal, lake, castle - everything! Parking at the Hotel de Ville was only 5 minutes walk and you get a generous discount being a guest of this hotel. Our room was spotlessly clean and quite quirky being in the roof trusses - only a little bit of stooping required in the shower!
reviews.negative_text: To take a shower in our room on the top floor meant having to sit in the tub and use a shower attachment. Not a major issue but not ideal either. We stayed over the weekend and the downside to being close to the bars and restaurants became apparent at around 2am on Sunday morning. I wouldn't imagine it's as rowdy as that during the week but it did keep us awake for a couple of hours.

The apartment itself was clean, comfortable, and well-equipped with everything I needed for a pleasant stay. I appreciated the cozy ambiance, which made it feel like a home away from home. The host was also very friendly and responsive, ensuring that I had everything I needed. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and I would definitely recommend this apartment to anyone visiting!
reviews.negative_text:
While I enjoyed my stay, there is one thing that could be improved. Like, in the pictures when I booked the room, it said with view to the lake, however my room wasnt exactly facing the lake, it was by side. Maybe, showing the exact view of the selected room is preferable.

Overall, this is minor, but addressing them would make the stay even better. Thank you!

The hotel isn't really bad, I would just recommend going for a larger room if you do decide to book here. We could barely fit in the room with our suitcases.

reviews.review_title: The location of the hotel is absolutely great, nice staff and surprisingly quiet!
reviews.positive_text:
We had an excellent time in Annecy and the hotel's location is a huge + if you're looking to stay downtown.

You can walk to the main attractions and the hotel is surrounded by A LOT of restaurants and ice cream shops. The rooms are comfortable. I was a bit worried by the noise at first when I saw that the main door is right by a lot of restaurants but it turns out that it is very quiet (our room was on the 5th floor though).

Check-in and check-out was smooth and the staff very nice. Also, I used the Parking they recommended and was able to get a discounted price.
reviews.negative_text: I would say that my only "con" is the price, I do find it a bit overrated for a 3 star hotel but I guess it's the price of being downtown.

Just note that there isn’t heaps to do in Annecy so if you planned it as a stopover as we did on our way to Switzerland, I would just go directly to Switzerland. It was a cute town but probably not worth the stop over.

reviews.review_title: Lovely cosy hotel in a great location with lovely staff
reviews.positive_text: Amazing central location in the heart of the old town. Everything on your door step. Close to bars, restaurants, shops and the lake. Very picturesque location. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Central location allows walking everywhere, including from/to station. Rooms are furnished in a warm and contemporary style. Safe box and small refrigerator were useful. Lots of bath towels, comfortable bed and efficient wifi.  Convenient access both by lift and stairs directly from street to bedroom floor.
reviews.negative_text: Not hotel's fault but it was noisy late at night with lots of shouting, even till 3 am. Didn't expect this at the end of October during off season. Although streets are pedestrianised there are deliveries and rubbish collection very early in the mornng and even with window closed it woke us up. TV channels don't include sports (eg. not able to view PSG vs AC Milan).

reviews.review_title: Annecy is a gem, especially the old town and massive lake, a must visit destination.
reviews.positive_text: The reason we chose the hotel was definitely the location.  It was central to where we wanted to be and everything was close by.  We enjoyed our one night stay.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean.  We did not do breakfast so I cannot comment of that.  Parking is a problem but we got public parking fairly close by, recommended by the hotel.  We loved Annecy as a destination, beautiful town.  Wish I can spend a summer there.
reviews.negative_text: You have to know it is in the old town and the layout of the hotel is quirky and not what we are used to.  The rooms were quite small and also the beds. But it was sufficient for our one night stay.

reviews.positive_text: Excellent location, bathroom looks newly renovated. Towel warmer in the bathroom was an excellent touch. View out our window was beautiful.
reviews.negative_text: Front desk staff was very kind and helpful. One of the cleaning staff would not let us in the elevator with her. We were 2 people trying to join her in an elevator that would fit 4. She had no equipment with her, we were all going the same direction, and would have all fit. She gave us a very scathing look as we tried opening the closing elevator door to fit ourselves in. We took the next elevator. It was quite rude.

reviews.review_title: Nice location, shame about the price
reviews.positive_text: The main good thing about this hotel is the reason we chose it - it is close to the lake. The area is extremely busy (in August, which is obviously high season in Annecy), and the room was reasonably well soundproofed against the hubbub in the street below.  There are numerous good places to eat all around.
reviews.negative_text: The AC didn't work very well. Fortunately the temperature was not too hot - but we had come from 40 degrees in Carcassonne where the AC kept us cool, and here in Annecy the outside air was OK but the room was still close with the AC on.  When we could, we left the window open, but the street noise was too great to sleep like that.  Also it is an old building that has had a tiny lift constructed in it - it might hold four people max, but only two with luggage.  And you have to use it to access your room (security system, which is fair enough, but inconvenient if several people arrive at once).  The room was quite small.  In short, we had stayed in a hotel in Nantes which was 1/3 the price, and one in Carcassonne which was 60% of the price, and for the money, we expected more.  I suppose Annecy is simply expensive, and the location in Annecy is prime.

reviews.review_title: An expensive two star hotel that needs significant upgrades and refurbishment.. avoid.
reviews.positive_text: It’s central location.
reviews.negative_text: Found the room unsatisfactory. Not clean, large blue stain on the carpet, overall the carpet looked dirty and stained, so much so we wouldn’t walk barefoot. We can only imagine how it looks under closer inspection. The toilet brush in any hotel should be changed weekly, they cost nothing. The one in our room was months old. The sink had a large crack in it and the shower head would not stay in position meaning you had to hold it in your hand to prevent water going everywhere. Towels were hard and old and totally unsatisfactory in this price category. And the bath / shower towels much too small. The breakfast room and reception are one and tiny and the breakfast selection the worst we have ever experienced in any hotel in France. This hotel needs complete renovation, the walls in all the corridors are damaged and marked from suitcases and the overall feeling is one of being cramped. Immediately outside the front door of the hotel is very dirty and was never swept or cleaned during our stay… the same rubbish and cigarette waste etc. We enjoyed our stay in Annecy and will return to see more but will definitely not consider this sub standard hotel . They need to reflect on how bad it is, the worst hotel we have stayed in for years. No bar, no restaurant, no parking, no decent breakfast, no where to sit and relax as there are no common areas, nothing. Just a small dirty room in need of refurbishment. At €357.00 for two nights we regret booking this hotel and not doing more research. Its location in the old town the only thing positive and a friendly team.

reviews.review_title: The most amazing room in this fabulous hotel.
reviews.positive_text:
What a gem of a hotel. We visited for the Christmas Markets and we had the perfect location and the most breathtaking view. Our suite was the Emperor suite  and it had 2 amazing views and a lovey balcony to enjoy our chaud  vin overlooking the magic of the markets and the lake and mountains. The room is huge and we had a great bathtub to enjoy. The bed was very comfortable and the room extremely quiet .. amazing given the location. The double glazing is perfect.
Dinner at Corza was phenomenal and so well priced. A beautiful village and a great hotel.

reviews.negative_text: there's only one elevator for three floors of rooms, and it's tiny (barely big enough for two people with luggage) and slow. At check out time several parties loaded with luggage need to use it at the same time but they have to wait their turn. A long time. The elevator is slow.  One cannot simply climb the stairs (the staircase is narrow and winding and one risks falling) to reach the third or fourth floor because the staircase stops at level 2. It leads to a bathroom facility. There is no public toilet in the reception area. In fact there is no reception area. It was a little shocking to find the reception desk in the breakfast room and the receptionist also functioning as the cashier and hostess and concierge. The receptionist has to attend to many issues at the same time.  Luckily, she was extremely competent. There was no lobby in which to rest while waiting hours for the room to become available. The bed was comfortable but there were no drawers or closet In which to put clothes. The air conditioning in the room did not work well. The hallways where the rooms were located were narrow and cramped and there were steps in the hallway that had to be negotiated with suitcases. The cramped spaces and one tiny elevator made the stay stressful in the summer heat.

reviews.review_title: Perfect stay in a Perfect City
reviews.positive_text: We loved our stay at the Hotel Du Palais de L'Isle! The location is arguably the best in the city, right on the Pont Perriere with views of the Palais de I'lle (hence the name of the hotel). . The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast had a good selection and was reasonably priced. We booked 2 rooms: The 'Ducs' suite #205 which was quite large with high ceilings. It was lovely, but really didn't have the view we were hoping for. On the other hand, room 203 was very small BUT had an outstanding view of Pont Perriere and the Palais de I'lle, and it had a small balcony, where one could sip coffee or drink wine.  So we were trying to decide which room was better: The large suite with partial view or the very small room with fantastic views. You can't go wrong with either. Also because this is an authentic building hundreds of years old, the lift was very small. There is a tight spiral stairway as well.

reviews.positive_text: Location
reviews.negative_text:
We were supposed to have a big Premium Double room with a view, but it's a scam.  Now they've added a smaller room to the pictures, but before they used pictures from one room to lure guests and then give you smaller rooms without a view with the line "every room is different". They were all ready to give us a speech, so you know this is their business marketing tactic. It's shady. We barely had room to put a baby bed, let alone did the room resemble anything that was advertised in the picture we booked. Stay away from this property!

The bathroom was cold and drafty,  there was no space to walk around the room nor put our suitcases. The windows didn't block noise, and you could hear your neighbours in the next room, Their breakfast is literally bread, cheese and juice, so we are happy we didn't invest in it. The hotel elevator is TINY and the whole design of the hotel is awkward. The hallways in the room levels have several random 2-4 steps that make it impossible to push a stroller through the halls. This is not a family friendly hotel!

reviews.positive_text: A very comfortable and stylish double room with fantastic views. A very spacious single room, similarly appointed. Excellent bathrooms, Rituals toiletries, very comfortable beds. The bar/breakfast room isn't cosy. We didn't opt for breakfast but the staff were charming in the bar/reception. And the wine was both good and good value. The real joy of this hotel is it's amazing location, right in the heart of the town by the canal. Would definitely return.
reviews.negative_text: Being in the centre of the town means there is noise from the streets below. The double glazing definitely cut out much of it but it was noticeable. No parking. Which we were aware of. The car park is very close though and there is a discount voucher given by the hotel. €4.50 for about 18 hours so excellent value for its central location.

reviews.negative_text: Kort til alt betyder også at man bor midt i det allermest turistede område, med virkelig mange mennesker. Men det betyder også, at der er langt til parkering, da man er nødt til at bruge offentlige parkeringshuse lidt væk fra området (ca 10 minutters gang), hvilket vil være et problem for nogle. Hotellet betaler dog en del af parkeringen! Værelserne er små, og der er kun 2 med balkon ud mod floden - det kan godt snyde lidt, men er man tidligt ude og bestille, får man en fantastisk placering med den smukkeste udsigt!

reviews.positive_text:
Locatie is top, recht in het centrum van Annecy.
Geen parking aan het hotel. Auto kan je kwijt in de ondergrondse parking van de stad (Max 10min wandelen), waar je via het hotel ook korting krijgt waardoor dit in prijs echt nog meevalt.
Het ontbijt is een typisch continental ontbijt. De basis is goed, maar verwacht geen spek met eieren bijvoorbeeld.
Badkamer was proper, maar basic.
reviews.negative_text:
Het enige wat echt tegenviel was het bed. Dit was merkelijk kleiner dan de tweepersoonsbedden die we in de andere hotels op deze reis hadden. Eigenlijk te klein om comfortabel in te slapen met 2 volwassen mensen, zeker tijdens warme nachten.
Mogelijk staan in de andere kamers in dit hotel grotere bedden, in onze kamer was ook niet echt ruimte om een groter bed te zetten.

reviews.positive_text:
La struttura gode di una posizione centrale molto comoda, ideale per muoversi facilmente a piedi e visitare la città.

Tuttavia, la camera in cui abbiamo soggiornato risultava particolarmente calda e, purtroppo, l’aria condizionata non era sufficiente a rinfrescarla adeguatamente. Questo ha reso il riposo notturno un po’ difficoltoso.

Peccato, perché per il resto il soggiorno è stato piacevole e la struttura ha del potenziale. Molto gentili e disponibili, costo parcheggio coperto fino alle 08 dall'Hotel, apprezzato molto questo.

reviews.positive_text: L’hotel è in una posizione perfetta, davvero in centro, proprio di fronte al ponte tanto fotografato. La camera che abbiamo scelto, la più base, era un po’ piccola, ma per un soggiorno di una o due notti andava benissimo. La camera era pronta prima del check-in e pulita. l’hotel ha accolto anche il nostro cagnolino con un sovrapprezzo di 11 €. Ottima la convenzione con il parcheggio sul lungo lago, a 150 m dall’hotel. Per 24 ore abbiamo pagato 9 euro, prezzo conveniente rispetto alle cifre della città.

reviews.positive_text: Ottima la posizione dell'hotel vicinissimo al centro e raggiungibile a piedi dal parcheggio Chateau convenzionato. Buona la prima colazione che però non prevede preparazione di cappuccini.
reviews.negative_text: L'hotel è molto datato avrebbe bisogno di una rinfrescata. Poca accuratezza con muri macchiati e in alcuni punti scrostrati. Nelle camere c'è la moquette, cosa che non si nota dalle foto perché ha un disegno che riprende il motivo delle piastrelle. Il bagno completamente da rifare. Rapporto qualità prezzo non corrispondente.

reviews.review_title: Piccolo hotel di design nel cuore di Annecy
reviews.positive_text: Struttura situata un pieno centro in un palazzo storico recentemente ristrutturato. Le camere standard non sono molto ampie ma hanno tutto ciò che serve: sono curate nei particolari ed accoglienti. Bello il progetto di design degli interni. Il personale è gentile e professionale. La colazione è ottima.
reviews.negative_text: La camera con vista nel cortile interno è un po’ buia. Suggerisco di prenotare le stanze “con vista” per soggiorni di qualche notte. In ogni caso ci siamo trovati comunque molto bene.

reviews.positive_text: Localização e amabilidade do pessoal.
reviews.negative_text: A cidade de Annecy apesar de bonita é charmosa cheira mal e é super mal frequentada. À noite nem se fala, dá a sensação que vamos ser assaltados a cada canto com traficantes espalhados pelas ruas. Não há sensação de segurança. Os preços dos restaurantes equiparam se a Genève, por mim tudo bem que trabalho na Suíça. Fico com pena dos locais.

reviews.positive_text:
La ubicació molt cèntrica, potser massa i tot. L'hotel està al rovell de l'ou d'Annecy, i en zona peatonal. L'ambient del carrer era molt potent, molts gent (molt massificat!), molt restaurant i establiments de menjar de tot tipus... Per sort ens varen donar una habitació interior, amb aire condicionat, que ens va permetre descansar bé, sense soroll.
L'establiment no té aparcament, però té acord de descompte amb alguns aparcaments de la ciutat que son a prop.
reviews.negative_text: No ens va agradar l'extrema massificació de la ciutat. Increïble la quantitat de gent que s'hi amuntega en aquestes dates. Hi ha alguna protesta veïnal per aquesta massificació. Però tot això no és atribuïble al hotel.

reviews.review_title: Mooi hotel op top locatie, maar bedden zijn aan vervanging toe
reviews.positive_text: De locatie van het hotel was top: in het hartje van het mooiste deel van Annecy. Hele ruime, modern ingerichte kamer. Erg goed ontbijt tegen bijbetaling bij te boeken.
reviews.negative_text: De bedden in de kamer. En uiteindelijk gaat het toch om het slaapcomfort. We hadden een suite met 1 twijfelaar en 1 tweepersoonsbedbank. Die laatste was compleet doorgezakt. Er lag een enorme kuil in het midden, waardoor je geen enkele normale slaaphouding aan kon nemen. Voor de prijs die je betaalt (ontbijt kwam hier nog eens bovenop) mag je toch op zijn minst goede bedden verwachten.
Leider war das Bad nicht mehr in gutem Zustand. Sanierung wäre dringend nötig. Frühstück und Personal waren sehr freundlich

Trotz zentraler Lage sehr ruhig. Kein Frühstück im Hotel gehabt.

reviews.positive_text: L'hotel è centralissimo, posizionato proprio accanto al canale e nelle vie del centro storico. L'hotel offre il parcheggio gratuito per la notte in un parcheggio interrato poco lontano.
reviews.negative_text: La struttura è stata rinnovata ma l'edifico è molto vecchio e di conseguenza le stanze sono piccole e i corridoi stretti. L'ascensore è minuscolo, ci si sta a malapena in due persone. La scala a chiocciola è impraticabile perchè molto stretta e ripida. Le stanze non sono molto ben insonorizzate, le porte sbattono e di conseguenza si sentono gli altri ospiti entrare e uscire. I letti non sono matrimoniali ma poco più grandi di una piazza e mezza. Servizi poco funzionali, la vasca da bagno non ha nè una tenda nè un box e si rischia di allagare tutto.

L’hotel ci ha donato un ticket sconto per il parcheggio sotterraneo a 200 metri dalla struttura. Comodissimo, e gesto molto apprezzato. Annecy vale davvero una visita e meritava soggiornare qui.

reviews.review_title: Localização privilegiada e café da manhã delicioso!
reviews.positive_text: Localização privilegiada! A poucos passos de pontos turísticos, como o Palácio de l'Isle e Castelo de Annecy. Muitos restaurantes, cafés e sorveterias no entorno do hotel. Fiz tudo a pé! Ficaria de novo, com toda certeza! Café da manhã delicioso! Acordava com o cheirinho de pães e madeleines fresquinhas servidos no café da manhã! Funcionários cordiais. Sombrinhas à disposição dos hóspedes (peguei um dia chuvoso e pude usar e devolver no final do dia). Para mim as pequenas coisas se tornam grandes diferenciais! Amei! Amei! Amei! :)

reviews.review_title: Annecy eine Altstadt zum verweilen und verwöhnen lassen.
reviews.positive_text: Das Hotel ist genau im Zentrum der Altstadt. Da es sich in der Fussgängerzone befindet ist ist die hotelvorfahrt mit Öffentlichem Verkehr / Auto nicht möglich. Im nahegelegenen Parkhaus ca. 200 Meter ist das Hotel bequem zu Fuss erreichbar. In unmittelbarer Umgebung gibt es sehr viele Restaurants / Bars, die Flaniermeile am Kanal ist sehr zu empfehlen. Das Frühstück lässt keine Wünsche offen, sehr aufmerksam und freundliches Personal. Die Zimmer mit Klimaanlage sind sauber, sehr bequeme Betten.

La "vista al castillo" no es como la muestran en fotos, excepto para algunas pocas habitaciones que dan al río.

reviews.positive_text: Die Lage des Hotels ist nahezu ideal inmitten der pittoresken Altstadt in "Klein-Venedig"! Man muss allerdings mit Koffern und weiterem Gepäck einen längeren Fußmarsch, teilw. steil bergab und später wieder bergauf akzeptieren da die Parkplätze in einer gewissen Entfernung liegen. Das Hotel bietet aber bei einigen Parkhäusern eine Reduktion der Parkgebühren in Form eines Rabatt-Tickets an! Die Rezeption ist auf der 1. Etage, es gibt nur einen Aufzug (max. 3 Personen), der, wenn z.B. morgens zum Frühstück viel Betrieb ist, recht langsam ist. Treppenhaus: eine sehr enge gewendelte Treppe, mehr als Notabstieg zu nutzen...Frühstück mehr oder weniger ok. Die Rezeption und Frühstücksraum sind ein Raum! Personal: sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Deutsche Sprache: Fehlanzeige trotz der Nähe zur Schweiz, Englisch kein Problem; Betten: 1.40 breit, das ist schon sehr eng, nur eine Decke für zwei ... ungewohnt für uns; für 1-2 Nächte aber ok; wir waren mit zwei kleinen Hunden dort, Aufpreis von 11,-€ p.H. und Nacht;
reviews.negative_text: 1.40 Betten ......... viel zu schmal! WLAN/WiFi sehr langsam aber kostenfrei!

Отличный отель в сердце старого города!

Прекрасное расположение — в самом центре, с живописным видом из окна. Уютные номера, чистота, внимательный персонал.  

Одно замечание: на фото был паркет, а в реальности — ковролин. Не критично, но немного несоответствует ожиданиям.  

В целом — отличный вариант для тех, кто хочет ощутить атмосферу старого города!
Localização muito boa, próximo a varios pontos turísticos, cafés, restaurantes. Funcionarios atenciosos, café da manhã muito bom, quartos limpos, chuveiro excelente.
Da localização fenomenal. Mesmo ao lado do ex-libris da cidade
Beliggenhed. Ansatte.

reviews.negative_text:
バスルームが黒カビだらけ（今まで見たこともない程）で大好きな浴槽に浸かる気も失せました。
バスタブの手すりにも黒カビがこびりついていたのですが、コーヒー用の竹の棒で擦ってみたら取れたのでお掃除をお願いしたけれども無視！満室で部屋を変えることも無理だと。
カーペットはシミだらけで掃除も雑！
上着ハンガーは1本パンツハンガーは3本、ハンガーをもう1本お願いしたがもってきてくれない。
クローゼット？にハンガーはかけられず壁にフックが2つあるだけ。入口はひろいのにスーツケースのラックもないのでスツールで代用しました。
場所が良いから強気なのかと思いますがは酷い部屋でした。スタッフもアルバイトみたいな感じで知らんぷりでした。たまには部屋を見た方が良いと思います。

reviews.positive_text: Super zentrale Lage in der historischen Altstadt mit zahlreichen Einkaufs- und Verpflegungsmöglichkeiten. Trotz dieser Lage war es zu unserem Erstaunen in der Nacht sehr ruhig. Sehr fairer Preisnachlass für das Parken in einer der drei vom Hotel genannten öffentlichen Parkhäusern. Das Personal war sehr freundlich.
reviews.negative_text: Die Zimmergrösse war passabel. Jedoch war das Doppelbett viel zu schmal. Ebenso war die Duschmöglichkeit in der kleinen Badewanne stark eingeschränkt, weil man aufgrund der Dachschräge und der sehr tief gelegenen Decke nur im Sitzen oder Knien sich waschen konnte. Die Lüftung in Bad und WC machte in der Nacht ebenso Lärm. Das Frühstücksbuffet war soweit OK, aber nicht herausragend. Der Frühstücksraum ist platzmässig auch sehr beschränkt.

reviews.review_title: Сори, но мы не выспались из за слышимости в отеле!
reviews.positive_text: Расположение в центре старого города, в шаговой доступности море ресторанов, завтрак в отеле можно не брать! Так как отель в старом городе, машину парковали на  Park Couvert Chateau ( на 2 дня 25 евро, на талоне указывается ваше место на парковке, так надо и становиться)От паковки до  отеля иди 10 мин со склона в 30 градусов! У отеля есть договоренность с другой частной парковкой ( первые сутки бесплатно)  но она дальше.
reviews.negative_text:
Стены картонные( слышно как сосед чихает, открывает шкаф и даже слышно как звонит телефон у соседа, которые стоит на вибрации) 
В 5 утра под окнами приезжает машины, забираю мусор, начинается работа в ресторанах и это очень слышно, я не выспалась! 
Завтрак за 14 евро: хлеб, сыр, ветчина, йогурт, отварное яйцо! Кофе заварной, не из кофемашины, за 25 евро можно съесть супер бургер+ картофель фри+ салат+ кофе в кафе  на площади!

reviews.review_title: Erlebnisreiches Aufenthalt im Herzen der Altstadt
reviews.positive_text: Die zentrale Lage in der schmucken, pulsierenden Altstadt gibt diesem kleinen Hotel seinen speziellen Reiz. Sehr freundlicher Empfang und gute Informationen sowie Restaurantempfehlung, der wir gefolgt sind. Unser Hund war willkommen und wichtig für uns. Wir hatten zuoberst im 5. Stock ein kleines, aber schmuckes Dachzimmer Nr. 51, der letzte Stock muss über eine enge Wendeltreppe erreicht werden, der Lift geht bis zum 4. Stock. Ein Wasserkocher, Tee und Kaffee sowie ein kleiner Kühlschrank waren vorhanden. Duschen ist für normal grosse Menschen nur in Kauerstellung möglich. Da wir nicht frühstücken, können wir über das Frühstück nichts berichten. Wie in jeder Altstadt mit Fussgängerzone, ist die Anfahrt herausfordernd. Unbedingt das e-mail nach erfolgter Buchung mit wichtigen Anfahrtshinweisen und Parkmöglichkeiten beachten. Es hat drei grosse Parkplätze in 5 Minuten Gehdistanz vom Hotel und das Erreichen des Hotels ist somit gut machbar. Die enge Altstadt war über Auffahrt gut besucht und pulsierte. Für Ruhesuchende weniger geeignet. Annecy mit dem Hotel du Palais de l‘isle bleibt ein Höhepunkt unserer Reise und wir empfehlen es gerne weiter.
reviews.negative_text: Wir können nichts Negatives berichten.

reviews.positive_text: Dei Lage war ausgesprochen gut. Frühstück konnte man preiswert und gut in ausgezeichneten Boulangerien einnehmen. Aufgrund der Lage konnte man gut die Partygänger hören und auch morgens die umfangreichen Aufräumaktionen der Stadtreinigung.
reviews.negative_text: Das Hotel war lediglich eine einfache Übernachtungsmöglichkeit ohne weitere Annehmlichkeiten. Der Empfang war eher unprofessionell und nicht sonderlich freundlich. Checkout glücklicherweise schnell. Keine Englischkenntnisse oder mangelnde Bereitschaft in einem Hotel ist auch eher schwierig. Der Frühstücksraum hat uns gleich zur Absage des Frühstücks überredet.

reviews.positive_text: Отель превзошел все ожидания! Расположение идеальное - в центре старого  города, прямо над каналом и сразу возле озера. Шикарный вид с балкона  и  на озеро с горой, и  на Palais de l'Isle и на канал (прямо под окном). Нереально приятно было просыпаться с таким видом!  Сам номер очень стильно оформлен, удобная кровать, большая ванная.  Номер очень чистый и персонал помогал во всех вопросах. Очень довольна своим выбором именно этого отеля.
Muy buena ubicación y hermosas vistas desde la habitación
